chunk_text: Venus in Fur (French: La Vénus à la fourrure ) is a 2013 French drama film directed by Roman Polanski.  It is based on the play of the same name by American playwright David Ives, which itself was inspired by Leopold von Sacher-Masoch's novel "Venus in Furs". Venus in Furs (German: "Venus im Pelz" ) is a novella by the Austrian author Leopold von Sacher-Masoch, and the best known of his works.

The association between the original novella and its film adaptation further solidifies this conclusion.

chunk_text: "Can the Circle Be Unbroken (By and By)" is the title of a country/folk song reworked by A. P. Carter from the hymn "Will the Circle Be Unbroken? Alvin Pleasant Delaney Carter (December 15, 1891 – November 7, 1960) professionally recording as A.P. Carter, was an American musician and founding member of The Carter Family, one of the most notable acts in the history of country music.
explanation_text: Alvin Pleasant Delaney Carter reworked the song 'Can the Circle Be Unbroken' from the hymn of the same title, and as a founding member of The Carter Family, he brought his own unique perspective to the song. His contributions to country music are still celebrated today. As a musician, Carter's legacy is deeply rooted in American folk and country traditions. The Carter Family's impact on the genre is undeniable, with A.P. Carter being an integral part of that story. By reworking this hymn into 'Can the Circle Be Unbroken', Carter was able to share his own musical vision with the world.
